page.title: 06WITNESHAM SAWMILLS
page.content: THEY ARE OWNED BY TITCHMARCH & GOODWIN CABINET MAKERS IN TRINITY WORKS,BACH HAMLET,IPSWICH.THEY MAKE ENGLISH REPRODUTION FURNITURE.IT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1920 AND THEY TOOK OVER THE OLD SAWMILL IN 1970 WHEN IT WAS DERELICT.THEY USE ENGLISH OAK,CHESTNUT, ASH,ELM,WILD CHERRY,YEW,WALNUT,BEECH AND OTHER ENGLISH HARDWOODS,MAINLY FROM EAST ANGLIA & EPPING FOREST.IMPORTED WOOD SUCH AS MAHOGANY ARE USED AS VENEERS. BOARDS ARE CUT TO VARIOUS THICKNESSES AARE THEN STACKED TO DRY (SEASON).OFTEN THE HEART OF THE WOOD IS CUT OUT TO STOP IT WARPING.IT TAKES MANY YEARS FOR THE WOOD TO SEASON BUT MOST OF IT IS SUITABLE AFTER 7 YEARS.THEY EVEN HAVE WOOD IN STOCK GOING BACK TO 1948.THE WOOD IS USED IN FURNITURE MAKING,D.I.Y WHERE WOOD IS CUT TO REQUIRED SIZES AND ALSO FOR REPAIRS.
